member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture
member.summary: Constants which identify the supported touch gestures

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture.None
member.summary: No gesture.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture.Zoom
member.summary: The zoom/pinch gesture. This gesture occurs when the user makes contact with the touch surface with two fingers, and moves them toward each other (pinch) or farther apart (zoom).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture.Pan
member.summary: The pan gesture. This gesture occurs when the user makes contact with the touch surface and drags a finger up/down or left/right. When the user loses contact with the touch surface, the scrolling continues, gradually decelerating. This is typically referred to as inertial panning.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture.Rotate
member.summary: The rotate gesture. This gesture occurs when the user holds one finger stationary on the touch surface while moving around that pivot point with a second finger.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture.TwoFingerTap
member.summary: The two-finger tap gesture. This gesture occurs when the user taps the touch surface with two fingers simultaneously, with the target defined as the midpoint between the two fingers.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture.PressAndTap
member.summary: The press and tap gesture. This gesture occurs when the user makes contact with the touch surface with one finger, and then taps with a second finger, while maintaining contact with the first finger.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.Gesture.PressAndHold
member.summary: The press and hold gesture. This gesture occurs when the user makes contact with the touch surface and does not move or release the finger until a specified period of time has elapsed.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes
member.summary: Flagged enumeration which defines gesture modes.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.None
member.summary: No gesture modes.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.Zoom
member.summary: The ZoomGesture event is enabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.Rotate
member.summary: The RotateGesture event is enabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.PanNoInertia
member.summary: The PanGesture event is enabled, but inertial panning is not enabled. Using this constant as opposed to the 'Pan' constant causes the PanGesture event to stop firing immediately upon the user's loss of contact with the touch surface.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.PanInertia
member.summary: When combined with the 'PanNoInertia' constant, enables inertial panning. Note that this constant only has significance when combined with the 'PanNoInertia' constant. Assigning this constant alone does not enable panning unless combined with the 'PanNoInertia' constant.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.Pan
member.summary: The PanGesture event is enabled, as is inertial panning.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.PressAndTap
member.summary: The PressAndTapGesture event is enabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.TwoFingerTap
member.summary: The TwoFingerGesture event is enabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.PressAndHold
member.summary: The PressAndHoldGesture event is enabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureModes.All
member.summary: Combines all bitflags, enabling all gesture events.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureEventArgs
member.summary: Base class for touch gesture-related event arguments.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureEventArgs.Gesture
member.summary: Returns a constant which identifies the touch gesture that triggered this event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the event has been handled.

remarks.p: To prevent the control's internal processing of the gesture, set the Handled property to true.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureEventArgs.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureQueryStatusEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the GestureQueryStatus event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureQueryStatusEventArgs.Location
member.summary: Returns the location of the touch point which triggered this event, expressed in client coordinates.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureQueryStatusEventArgs.Mode
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating which gestures will cause events to fire.

remarks.p: The GestureModes type is a flagged enumeration; as such, any combination of gesture modes can be allowed or blocked.
For example, to enable only panning and zooming, set the Mode property to the bitwise OR combination GestureModes.Pan | GestureModes.Zoom.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.GestureQueryStatusEventArgs.PressAndHoldDelay
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the user must hold a touch point stationary in order to trigger the PressAndHoldGesture event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PanGestureEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the PanGesture event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PanGestureEventArgs.Location
member.summary: Returns the location of the contact point at the time this event was fired.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PanGestureEventArgs.Gesture
member.summary: Returns a constant identifying the gesture which triggered this event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PanGestureEventArgs.HorizontalInertia
member.summary: Returns a vector which describes the horizontal inertia for this event.

remarks.p: Panning inertia refers to the deceleration in scrolling speed that occurs after the user loses contact with the touch surface.

NOTE that the magnitude of this value is driver-dependent. The sign of the value, which represents the direction of movement, is always negative when scrolling toward the right (viewport moves toward the left), and positive when scrolling toward the left (viewport moves toward the right).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PanGestureEventArgs.VerticalInertia
member.summary: Returns a vector which describes the vertical inertia for this event.

remarks.p: Panning inertia refers to the deceleration in scrolling speed that occurs after the user loses contact with the touch surface.

NOTE that the magnitude of this value is driver-dependent. The sign of the value, which represents the direction of movement, is always negative when scrolling downward (viewport moves up), and positive when scrolling upward (viewport moves down).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PanGestureEventArgs.IsInertial
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this event was triggered by inertia.

remarks.p: Panning inertia refers to the deceleration in scrolling speed that occurs after the user loses contact with the touch surface.
Use the HorizontalInertia and VerticalInertia properties to differentiate between inertia in the horizontal and vertical directions.

member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.

member.summary: Defines the signature of the handler for the PanGesture event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.ZoomGestureEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the ZoomGesture event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.ZoomGestureEventArgs.Gesture
member.summary: Returns a constant identifying the gesture which triggered this event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.ZoomGestureEventArgs.Center
member.summary: Returns the location of the point which lies midway between the two contact points for this gesture.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.ZoomGestureEventArgs.Distance
member.summary: Returns the distance between the gesture's contact points for this event, expressed in pixels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.ZoomGestureEventArgs.Origin
member.summary: Returns the original contact point with the surface. Can be used to determine if the gesture was zoom or pinch.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.ZoomGestureEventArgs.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.ZoomGestureHandler
member.summary: Defines the signature of the handler for the ZoomGesture event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.RotateGestureEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the RotateGesture event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.RotateGestureEventArgs.Gesture
member.summary: Returns a constant identifying the gesture which triggered this event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.RotateGestureEventArgs.Pivot
member.summary: Returns the touch point around which the rotation occurred for this gesture.

remarks.p: The pivot point represents the location of the finger which remains stationary. The pivot point defines the vertex for the gesture's angle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.RotateGestureEventArgs.Angle
member.summary: Returns the angle of rotation, expressed in degrees.

remarks.p: The sign of the angle indicates the direction of movement around the pivot point In the first and second quadrants, a negative value indicates movement in a clockwise direction; in the third and fourth quadrants, the sign is reversed, with negative values indicating counter-clockwise movement.

Note that the frame of reference for the rotate gesture is defined by the first contact point, and not by the contact point's orientation with respect to the screen. For example, a gesture which begins with the moving finger at the nine o'clock position of the pivot point is indistinguishable from one which begins with the moving finger at the twelve o'clock position (assuming the movement is in the same direction in both cases).
The vertext of the angle is defined by the Angle property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.RotateGestureEventArgs.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.RotateGestureHandler
member.summary: Defines the signature of the handler for the RotateGesture event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the PressAndTapGesture event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs.Gesture
member.summary: Returns a constant identifying the gesture which triggered this event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs.HorizontalDelta
member.summary: Returns the horizontal delta for this event.

remarks.p: The delta represents the distance between the horizontal components of the PressLocation and TapLocation, relative to the PressLocation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs.VerticalDelta
member.summary: Returns the vertical delta for this event.

remarks.p: The delta represents the distance between the vertical components of the PressLocation and TapLocation, relative to the PressLocation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs.PressLocation
member.summary: Returns the location of the pressed point for this gesture.

remarks.p: This property returns the location of the first touch point, which was held stationary while the second touch point is tapped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs.TapLocation
member.summary: Returns the location of the tapped point for this gesture.

remarks.p: This property returns the location of the second touch point.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs.SendMouseDown
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the control's MouseDown event is raised in response to this event.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the TimeElapsed property returns zero, indicating that this is the first of the two firings of the events for this gesture.

Since a context menu is typically displayed in response to the PressAndTapGesture event, and because many applications use the MouseDown event to initialize a context menu, a WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is sent to the control, causing the MouseDown event to fire. This property can be set to false to prevent this behavior.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureEventArgs.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndTapGestureHandler
member.summary: Defines the signature of the handler for the PressAndTapGesture event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.TwoFingerTapGestureEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the TwoFingerTapGesture event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.TwoFingerTapGestureEventArgs.Gesture
member.summary: Returns a constant identifying the gesture which triggered this event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.TwoFingerTapGestureEventArgs.Location1
member.summary: Returns the location of the first touch point.

remarks.p: Because this event is triggered by the simultaneous pressing of two touch points, there is no distinction between the first and second locations, other than there position on the screen.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.TwoFingerTapGestureEventArgs.Location2
member.summary: Returns the location of the second touch point.

remarks.p: Because this event is triggered by the simultaneous pressing of two touch points, there is no distinction between the first and second locations, other than there position on the screen.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.TwoFingerTapGestureHandler
member.summary: Defines the signature of the handler for the TwoFingerTapGesture event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndHoldGestureEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about the PressAndHoldGesture event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndHoldGestureEventArgs.Gesture
member.summary: Returns a constant identifying the gesture which triggered this event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndHoldGestureEventArgs.Location
member.summary: Returns the location of the touch point at which this gesture occurred, expressed in client coordinates.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndHoldGestureEventArgs.TimeElapsed
member.summary: Returns the time elapsed, in milliseconds, since the user began the press and hold gesture, or zero if this event signifies the beginning of the gesture.

remarks.p: The PressAndHoldGesture event always fires twice, unless the Cancel returns true. The first firing occurs when the user has pressed and held the touch surface, without moving, for a period of time equal to the PressAndHoldDelay property. The TimeElapsed property returns zero in this case.

The second firing occurs when the user loses contact with the touch surface. The value of this property contains the amount of time the user maintained contact with the touch surface after the first firing of the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndHoldGestureEventArgs.ShowIndicator
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether a PressAndHoldIndicatorUIElement is displayed while the press and hold gesture is in progress.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the TimeElapsed property returns zero, indicating that this is the first of the two firings of the events for this gesture.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndHoldGestureEventArgs.SendMouseDown
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the control's MouseDown event is raised immediately after execution returns from the firing of this event.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the TimeElapsed property returns zero, indicating that this is the first of the two firings of the events for this gesture.

Since a context menu is typically displayed in response to the PressAndHoldGesture event, and because many applications use the MouseDown event to initialize a context menu, a WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is sent to the control, causing the MouseDown event to fire. This property can be set to false to prevent this behavior.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.PressAndHoldGestureEventArgs.EnablePanning
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value indicating whether the PanGesture event will be allowed to occur if the user changes position on the touch surface before losing contact.

remarks.p: The EnablePanning property is only applicable for the first occurrence of the PressAndHold event, i.e., before the user has lost contact with the touch surface.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.TouchSupport.IsTouchSupported
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the local machine supports a touch-enabled input digitizer.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether touch input is supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Touch.TouchSupport.IsTouchSupported(System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the local machine supports a touch-enabled input digitizer.
member.param: [out] Upon return, indicates whether the device supports multiple touch points.
[out] Upon return, indicates whether the device is currently ready for input.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether touch input is supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.DataSource.IDataSource.QueueAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to manually queue a refresh of the data source.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.DataSource.IDataSource.DeferAutoRefresh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto refresh mechanism of the data source is currently defered. The data source will not react to most setting changes while this is set to true an will instead defer processing. Setting this value to false will queue a new refresh.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.DataSource.IDataSource.FlushAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to make sure a queued refresh of the data source has been applied before continuing. Should only be needed if you are trying to synchronously examine the results of changing settings on the data source. Note, for a virtual data source, the data source itself may be waiting for other synchronous requests to actualize data. This call will not wait for those, but will only make sure the appropriate requests are in flight from the settings changes

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.DataSource.IDataSource.Refresh
member.summary: Called to synchronously refresh the data source.

member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references that indicate the user provided primary key of the items in the data source. Consumers of the data source will often need to uniquely identify items in the data source. For this purpose a primary key should be specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.DataSource.IDataSource.ActualPrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets the current actual primary key of the data source. This may have been auto detected, if possible, or provided or overriden by the user.

member.summary: Flags for specifying how text is to be measured/rendered.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GdiDrawStringFlags.None
member.summary: No special considerations are given to the measurement/rendering.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GdiDrawStringFlags.DirectionVertical
member.summary: The measurement/rendering is intended for text that is drawn with vertical orientation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GdiDrawStringFlags.IsPrinting
member.summary: The measurement/rendering is for printing.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GdiDrawStringFlags.GDIPlus
member.summary: The preferred method of measurement/rendering should use GDI+. Note that if both the GDI+ and GDI flags are specified, GDI+ will be given preference.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GdiDrawStringFlags.GDI
member.summary: The preferred method of measurement/rendering should use GDI. Note that if both the GDI+ and GDI flags are specified, GDI+ will be given preference.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GdiDrawStringFlags.Themed
member.summary: The measurement/rendering is for themed text. Note that this flag will take precedence over GDI and GDI+.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GdiDrawStringFlags.ThemedWithGlow
member.summary: The measurement/rendering is for themed text with glow, available only on Vista. Note that this flag will take precedence over GDI and GDI+.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.TextRendererWrapper
member.summary: Using TextRenderer.DrawText leads to various artifacts when drawing to transparent images. This class is added in order to workaround this issue. First it draws the text to a temporary image. Then it process the temporary image and fixes its artifacts. Finally the temporary image is drawn on the actual graphics object. Note that for drawing we use Color.Magenta as it gives us good, predictable result. After that the color of the text is changed from Magenta to the actual forecolor of the text when the image is processed

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.TextRendererWrapper.DrawText(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String,Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.DrawCache,System.Drawing.Color,Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Point,System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags,System.Nullable{System.Drawing.Size})
member.summary: Draws the specified text to the graphics object by first drawing to a temporary image, then processing it in order to remove any GDI artifacts and then draws the temporary image to the graphics object
member.param: The graphics object to draw into
The text to draw
The DrawCache which contains various properties used for the drawing
The color of the text
The location where to draw the text
The TextRenderingFlags to use when drawing the text
The size of the text. If not specified, the method will use MeasureText in order to calculate it

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush
member.summary: Paints an area with a linear gradient.

remarks.p:
This class supports bi-directional conversion for the following types:
System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush

member.summary: Returns the default value of the StartPoint property (0, 0).

member.summary: Returns the default value of the EndPoint property (1, 0).

member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.#ctor(Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.GradientStopCollection)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of this class using the specified GradientStopCollection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.#ctor(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Point,Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Point)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinearGradientBrush class that has the specified start color, end color, start point, and end point.
member.param: The color at offset 0.0.
The color at offset 1.0.
The start point of the gradient.
The start point of the gradient.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.#ctor(System.Nullable{Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Point},System.Nullable{Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Point},System.Drawing.Color[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Used for designer serialization.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.StartPoint
member.summary: Returns or sets the starting two-dimensional coordinates of the linear gradient.

remarks.p: The range of valid values for both the X and Y components is between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive, and represent a vector expressed relative to the upper left corner of the area in which the gradient is displayed.
A value of zero represents the leftmost/topmost point of the area in which the gradient is displayed; a value of one represents the rightmost/bottommost point.
Any value between 0 and 1 is interpreted as a ratio which describes the location as relative to the top left corner of the area in which the gradient is displayed.
Any value which is less than zero or greater than one causes an exception to be thrown.
For example, given an area that is 100 pixels square, a value of (0.5, 0.25) coincides with the coordinate (50, 25).
In the absence of an explicit setting, the value of this property resolves to (0.0, 0.0).

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.ShouldSerializeStartPoint
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the StartPoint property has been explicitly set.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.ResetStartPoint
member.summary: Restores the value of the StartPoint property to its default setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.EndPoint
member.summary: Returns or sets the ending two-dimensional coordinates of the linear gradient.

remarks.p: The range of valid values for both the X and Y components is between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive, and represent a vector expressed relative to the upper left corner of the area in which the gradient is displayed.
A value of zero represents the leftmost/topmost point of the area in which the gradient is displayed; a value of one represents the rightmost/bottommost point.
Any value between 0 and 1 is interpreted as a ratio which describes the location as relative to the top left corner of the area in which the gradient is displayed.
For example, given an area that is 100 pixels square, a value of (0.5, 0.25) coincides with the coordinate (50, 25).
In the absence of an explicit setting, the value of this property resolves to (1.0, 0.0).

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.ShouldSerializeEndPoint
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the EndPoint property has been explicitly set.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.ResetEndPoint
member.summary: Restores the value of the EndPoint property to its default setting.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.ToBrush(Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush,Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Rectangle)
member.summary: Returns a System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush initialized from the specified Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.LinearGradientBrush instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.ToBrush(Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.LinearGradientBrush,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush initialized from the specified Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.LinearGradientBrush instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.ToBrush
member.summary: Returns an Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.LinearGradientBrush initialized from this instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.FromBrush(System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush,System.Nullable{Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Point},System.Nullable{Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.Point})
member.summary: Returns a Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush instance initialized from the specified System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush instance.
member.param: The System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush instance from which to initialize the new Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush instance
The start point for the gradient, or null if the default start point should be used (0, 0).
The end point for the gradient, or null if the default end point should be used (1, 0).
member.returns: A Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush instance.

remarks.p: The and parameters are necessary because the System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush class does not expose these values as public properties.
In the absence of an explicit setting, the and default to the values (0, 0) and (1, 0), respectively, which causes the gradient to progress along the horizontal plane from left to right.

The and parameters are used to specify the angle of the gradient. For example, given a startPoint of (0, 0) and an endPoint of (1, 1), the resulting angle is 45 degrees, producing a gradient which progresses in the forward diagonal direction.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.op_Implicit(Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.LinearGradientBrush)~Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush
member.summary: Creates a new Infragistics.WIn.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush from the specified Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.LinearGradientBrush.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush.op_Implicit(System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush)~Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush
member.summary: Creates a new Infragistics.Win.DataVisualization.LinearGradientBrush from the specified System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush

remarks.p: Because the System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush class does not publicly expose properties for the start and end points of the gradient, This operator ignores the start and end points of the specified LinearGradientBrush.

member.summary: Runs the built-in test suite.
member.returns: true if all tests pass

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LinearFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the linear least squares fit y=A+Bx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFitting.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.summary: Evaluate the linear function y=a[0]+a[1]*x
member.param: function coefficients
function evaluation point
member.returns: Evaluated function, or NaN if the function cannot be evaluated

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LinearTest
member.summary: Tests linear fitting.
member.returns: true if tests pass.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LogarithmicFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the logarithmic least squares fit y=A+Blnx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN or the x is not positive, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting--Logarithmic." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFittingLogarithmic.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

function evaluation point
member.returns: Evaluated function, or NaN if the function cannot be evaluated

member.summary: Tests logarithmic fitting.

member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.ColorUtil.GetInterpolation(Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.Color,System.Double,Infragistics.Portable.Graphics.Media.Color,Infragistics.Portable.InterpolationMode)
member.summary: Get an interpolation from the current color to the specified color

interpolation parameter assumed to be in [0.0, 1.0]
end color, corresponding to p=1.0
Interpolation mode to use.
member.returns: new color corresponding to the specified interpolation parameter

end color, corresponding to p=1.0
member.returns: new color corresponding to the specified interpolation parameter
member.remarks: There are always two interpolation paths for the hue, and this function chooses the shortest one, so for example an interpolation from red to blue runs through purple, not orange, yellow and green.

The lightness, expressed as a value between 0 and 1, where 0 is black and 1 is white.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.RectUtil.GetInflated(Infragistics.Portable.Rect,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Expands or shrinks the current rectangle by using the specified width and height amounts, in all directions. The size and position of the current rectangle are not changed.
member.remarks:
The Width of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified width offset, because it is applied to both the left and right sides of the rectangle. Likewise, the Height of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified height.
If the specified width or height shrink the rectangle by more than its current Width or Height—giving the rectangle a negative area—the rectangle becomes the Empty rectangle.
member.param: The source rectangle.
The amount by which to expand or shrink the left and right sides of the rectangle.
The amount by which to expand or shrink the top and bottom sides of the rectangle.
member.returns: Inflated rectangle.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1
member.summary: Represents a pool of reusable objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and returns an instance of a StackPool.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.Pop
member.summary: Gets an object from the pool.
member.remarks: The pool will either Create a new object or Activate one which was previously returned and Disactivated. If DeferDisactivate is set there may be pending active objects available which will be reused directly).
member.returns: An object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.Push(`0)
member.summary: Returns an object to the pool for recycling.
member.remarks:
All references to objects which have been returned to the pool should be destroyed.
When an object is returned to the pool it will be immediately Disactivated (unless DeferDisactivate is set) and may also be Destroyed either immediately or some time later.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.DeferDisactivate
member.summary: Sets or gets the DeferDisactivate flag.
member.remarks:
When the pool is marked to defer disactivation, objects returned to the pool are not immediately disactivated, instead remaining in a limbo state where they are available for reuse without Activation. Resetting DeferDisactivate causes all of these limbo objects to be disactivated and potentially destroyed.
Deferred disactivation is useful where the activation/disactivation cycle is costle (such as add/remove a VisualElement from a ParentItem Panel).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.ActiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of active items in the current StackPool object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.StackPool`1.InactiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of inactive (not including limbo) items in the current StackPool object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to create new items.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to disactivate items.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable
member.summary: Interface for objects placed by a smart placer object.
member.remarks: Although there is a clear intent to SmartPosition values, implementing classes are free to interpret the values as they wish. The only restriction being that the position parameter be interpreted coherently: the bounds set by calling SetPosition() should be identical to those returned by calling GetPosition()

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartPositions
member.summary:
Gets an array of valid positions for the current object. Objects can individually place restrictions on where they can be placed, although in reality it's more likely that they'll just return a static array.
The order of the valid positions has some significance, in that although the placer will choose the best overall position, it will stop searching as soon as it finds an ideal one. The upshot of all of this is that you should return an array sorted in order of preferred placement.
member.returns: Array of valid smart positions for the current object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartBounds(Infragistics.Portable.SmartPosition)
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the current object if it were placed at the specified position.
member.param: Smart position for bounds.
member.returns: Bounds for the current object

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.SmartPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the current object.
member.remarks: After the smart position is set, the current object's bounds are assumed to be that returned from GetSmartBounds() if called with the same position.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable.Opacity
member.summary: Sets or gets the opacity of the current object.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Portable.SmartPlacer
member.summary: Manages the position for each object in a set of managed SmartPositions in an attempt to minimise overlap.
member.remarks: Collision avoidance uses a greedy algorithm running in O(n^2) with O(n) storage. Although there are no known algorithms running in less time than this, simulated annealing may produce slightly better results with comparable execution time.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.SmartPlacer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new SmartPlacer with the default configuration.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.SmartPlacer.Bounds
member.summary: Sets or gets the placement bounds for this smart placer. Setting the placement bounds has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.SmartPlacer.Overlap
member.summary: Sets or gets the maximum permissible placed overlap expressed as a percentage [0, 1] of each placeable's area. Setting the placement overlap has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Portable.SmartPlacer.Fade
member.summary: Sets or gets the fade exponent for ISmartPlaceables which exceed the current overlap. Setting the placement fade has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Portable.SmartPlacer.Place(Infragistics.Portable.ISmartPlaceable)
member.summary:
Place the object with respect to currently placed object. Calling this method causes the object to be immediately updated, but has no effect on previously placed objects.
Placeables which cannot be placed within the placement bounds or without overlapping previously placed objects are hidden
member.param: Object to place.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.LastVisibleIndexRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets which index consumers of the data source desire to be the current last visible index. A grid, for example, would indicate the current visible top row, and update this as that changes.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.ShouldSerializeLastVisibleIndexRequested
member.summary: Indicates if the property needs to be serialized.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if the property needs to be serialized.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.ResetLastVisibleIndexRequested
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyUsingSourceIndexes
member.summary: Gets whether, when manually notifying the data source of changes, one should use indexes relative to the actual source data, or relative to the view the data source is maintaining into the data.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references that indicate the user provided primary key of the items in the data source. Consumers of the data source will often need to uniquely identify items in the data source. For this purpose a primary key should be specified.

member.summary: Indicates if the property needs to be serialized.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if the property needs to be serialized.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.ResetPrimaryKey
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.PropertiesRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of property references for the properties desired by the consumer of the data source. member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.ResetPropertiesRequested

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.FlushAutoRefresh
member.summary: Called to make sure a queued refresh of the data source has been applied before continuing. Should only be needed if you are trying to synchronously examine the results of changing settings on the data source. Note, for a virtual data source, the data source itself may be waiting for other synchronous requests to actualize data. This call will not wait for those, but will only make sure the appropriate requests are in flight from the settings changes

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.GetIsRowExpandedAtIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the expansion state for a row.
member.param: The row to check.
member.returns: Is the row expanded or not.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.GetItemAtIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the item at the specific index in the data source. This index is based on the data source's current view of the data, not the actual underlying indexes of the original source.
member.param: The index of the requested item.
member.returns: The item at the requested index.

member.summary: Extracts the value of a named property for an item contained in the data source.

The name of the property to extract a value from.
member.returns: The value of the specified property.

The property value from which to extract a value.

member.summary: Gets the hierarchy level of the row.
member.param: The row to check.
member.returns: The hierarchy level.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IndexOfItem(System.Object)
member.summary: Called to return the index for an item contained in the data source, or -1, if the item can't be found, or this action isn't currently supported.
member.param: The item for which to find the index.
member.returns: The index if possible, or -1

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IndexOfKey(System.Object[])
member.summary: Called to return the index for an primary key value contained in the data source, or -1, if the key can't be found, or this action isn't currently supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.IsPlaceholderItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the item at the requested index is a placeholder item and has not been actualized.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyClearItems
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that the data it has bound to has been cleared and needs to be re-examined. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyInsertItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been inserted in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the inserted item.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifyRemoveItem(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been removed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the removed item.
The old item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.DataSource.BaseDataSource.NotifySetItem(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Manually notifies the data source that an item has been changed in the data it is bound to. This should not be necessary to call if the data that the data source is bound to is already observable.
member.param: The index of the changed item.
The old item at the desginated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.
The new item at the designated index. You can optionally omit this value only if IsVirtual == true for this data source.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the auto refresh mechanism of the data source is currently defered. The data source will not react to most setting changes while this is set to true an will instead defer processing. Setting this value to false will queue a new refresh.

Transform the provided page index into a different index if required.
In VirtualDataSource, the page prediction is working in a different coordinate system than the OData/SQLite/etc. paging coordinates when grouping is active so this method will transform the page index from the paging system coordinates to the OData/SQLite/etc. coordinates.

member.returns: The transformed page index.

member.name: T:Infragistics.PolySimplification
member.summary: Utility class for polygon simpliciation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.PolySimplification.VertexReduction(System.Tuple{System.Double[],System.Double[]},System.Double)
member.summary:
Simple vertex reduction algorithm. Complexity: O(n)
Summary: Include P0 in the result, and set R = P0. Iterate through subsequent points P1,P2,... until distance(PN, R) > tolerance. Include PN in the result, and set R = PN. Continue iterating in this fashion until there are no more points to consider for inclusion.
member.param: Input list of points
The minimum distance allowed between adjacent points
member.returns: List of accepted points

member.name: M:Infragistics.PolySimplification.SquareDistance(Infragistics.Portable.Point,Infragistics.Portable.Point)
member.summary: Returns the square of the distance between p1 and p2.
